data.name: Sherlock in bookstore
data.description:
You are building software for internet shop with books about Sherlock Holmes. The main reason people buy in your shop are coupons they found on the Internet.

Write a function to calculate the order value after applying coupon. Order value should not be negative and should be rounded to two decimal points. 

The coupon can have percent discount when its value is fraction (i.e. > -1) or amount discount $1, $40, etc. Valid coupons have negative values.

The coupon can define which product it is related to, and only this product (if in order) can be discounted.

Examples:
```ruby
coupon_1 = { value: -0.2 } # => 20% on whole order
coupon_2 = { value: -7 } # => order total value lowered by 7$ or whatever currency you like
coupon_3 = { value: -0.1, product: :signs_of_four }  # => 10% for product :signs_of_four
```

An order is just a hashmap where keys are products and values are their prices.

```ruby
order = {
    signs_of_four: 10,
    adventures: 13
}
```

Examples of results:
```ruby
apply_coupon(coupon_1, order) # => 18.4
apply_coupon(coupon_2, order) # => 16
apply_coupon(coupon_3, order) # => 22
```
